dataset_name: US Census Disability Statistics by State (2021)
source: US Census Bureau, American Community Survey (ACS) 5-Year Estimates, 2021

fields.disability_total: Total number of people with any disability
fields.disability_rate: Overall disability rate as a percentage of total population
fields.hearing_difficulty: Number of people with hearing difficulty
fields.hearing_rate: Hearing difficulty rate as a percentage
fields.vision_difficulty: Number of people with vision difficulty
fields.vision_rate: Vision difficulty rate as a percentage
fields.cognitive_difficulty: Number of people with cognitive difficulty
fields.cognitive_rate: Cognitive difficulty rate as a percentage
fields.ambulatory_difficulty: Number of people with ambulatory (walking) difficulty
fields.ambulatory_rate: Ambulatory difficulty rate as a percentage
fields.self_care_difficulty: Number of people with self-care difficulty
fields.self_care_rate: Self-care difficulty rate as a percentage
fields.independent_living_difficulty: Number of people with independent living difficulty
fields.independent_living_rate: Independent living difficulty rate as a percentage

notes: State-level disability prevalence data from the ACS covering 50 states plus DC and PR (52 rows). Breaks down disability into 6 categories: hearing, vision, cognitive, ambulatory, self-care, and independent living. Rates are percentages of the total civilian noninstitutionalized population. Used for accessibility awareness visualizations.
